Everything was perfect â€” especially the dessert! ğŸ°

I was very excited for my dinner here. I enter the restaurant, look at the menu it was $75 for a steak and $16 for the fries I was appalled by those prices but I got over it as it was a fancy restaurant. I asked for it without the dusting as I'm a picky eater. The food came out, there were mountains of the dusting on it so I was angry my mom didn't let me complain as the people were very nice . I west to the restroom to cool down as I was very angry. So I walk into the stall, I saw a dead cockroach on the floor. In a fancy restaurant I expect much better. The food not being done correctly and the roach on the floor was disgraceful. I would not come back
â€¢ Ever.
Love this spot.  Iâ€™m from Pittsburgh.  Pittsburgh steak? Yes please!!
Buffy was amazing! She elevated the experience x1000.  Highly recommend the Strip House!

great food and fantastic service ..first place iâ€™ve ever been too where the waiter asked all of our names, remembered them, and used them ..steak was amazing as was the chicken tarragon ..blood orange Cosmo great drink

The wait to visit was worth it, as the food was everything I wanted. The meals delighted everyone, though Strip House Steakhouse truly distinguishes itself through affordability and staff quality. Strip House Steakhouse enjoys an ideal address as well. They serve substantial portions, and I had extra for later! This spot needs to be on your list now.

Where to begin? The atmosphere was inviting, loved looking at the photographs on the wall and trying to figure out which celebrities we recognized. Blood-orange cosmo is the best drink! The filet was perfect, the pepper corn crust was fantastic. I will be dreaming of those 1000 layer goose fat potatoâ€™s until I can get them again.

Would recommend getting the Baked Alaska for desert.

The waiter was beyond rude and bothered! Took 25 mins for our drinks to arrive, then another hour for 2 appetizers. He forgot to put in the oyster Rockefeller appetizer and didnâ€™t even apologize! We had to get up and leave to proceed to speak to the manager who seemed VERY out of it as if he just woke up. The staff ( especially the server & bus boy ) were extremely rude and I felt uncomfortable exposing my family to that environment.  Had to leave before even getting our steak. .
One of the worst dining experiences Iâ€™ve had in NYC. Very disappointed. Service was horrible. Many better options in NYC.

Strip House Steakhouse is a true New York classic â€” an iconic spot just down the road from the Sofitel New York Hotel. The space has timeless, old-school New York charm, and the service is exceptional from start to finish. The steaks are perfectly cooked, sides are delicious, and the cocktails are spot on. Highly recommended for anyone staying nearby or looking for an unforgettable New York steakhouse experience. Thank you to the wonderful staff for making the night so enjoyable!
Avoid.  Much better steakhouses in the vicinity.  Service is awful.

Favorite Blue Cheese Olive Martini in the city

Bryan was it is the most wonderful serverIâ€™ve ever had!  His service was exceptional!   He suggested the best wine to go with our meal
And during our dinner he checked in to see how we liked everything!  Highly recommend!!

This meal, which was the last schedule of our 10th anniversary trip, was the most enjoyable and happy experience. Delicious steaks, side dishes, and wine were perfect. And Brian, who was in charge of us, made us shine in a more meaningful place as a celebration for us.

Strip House is our go-to steakhouse in NYC. From the addictive pretzel bread to perfectly prepared steaks, every visit feels like a treat. The vibe is classic but lively â€” exactly what you want in a New York steakhouse.
Ordered the NY Strip and it was excellent.   Extremely filling.
Great food and atmosphere. Top 3 steak place in NYC.
Delicious Kansas bone-in strip ribeye. Sides were tasty too. Drinks were fabulous - great location!
Tomahawk ì¶”ì²œë“œë ¤ìš”. ìë¦¬ë„ ë„“ê³  ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ ìµœê³ ì—ìš”
Foods are impressive! Loved the roasted garlic that came with the steak and creamed spinach. Great and fast service.

Loved all those 1920s female pics on the wall.Server was so nice and the atmosphere is great for conversation over meal.Had NY Strips Spinach in cream were all nice but the Brussells sprout sauce was way too sweet

Their truffle spinach is amazing!!
The porterhouse steak is quite enough for two people to feel full.
Their extremely large 24 layer signature chocolate cake was a little disappointing though. Not as rich as I expected, and a little too sweet for my taste.
I tried both this Strip House Steakhouse and the one downtown, and this place was much noisier and busier.

Everything about this steakhouse is perfect. From the lobster bisque to the black truffle & blue cheese martinis, to the NY strip au poivre, and the Ny cheese cake with fresh berries. Every bite is amazing. A perfectly cooked steak, very flavorful berries, rich cheese cake. It's not just the best for the price, it's the best at any price. Generous portions, friendly staff, relaxing atmophere. A beautiful Resturaunt all around. I especially loved the Kung Pao brussel sprouts. And the Oreo cheese cake!
Great food, great location for pre-show dinner, wonderful service (hat tip Alyssa)
Consistently one of the best steakhouses in the city. Bone in ribeye special was grilled to perfection and so dang good.
Excellent steaks.  Good service.
Je recommande ce restaurant si vous dÃ©sirez manger une viande.  Repas excellent, service parfait. Une trÃ¨s bonne adresse. N'oubliez pas le dessert si vous aimez le gÃ¢teau au chocolat !
ãƒ‹ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ¨ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚‰ã—ã„ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚­ãƒã‚¦ã‚¹ï¼ã¨ã¦ã‚‚ç¾å‘³ã—ã‹ã£ãŸã§ã™ï¼

Incredible dinner! The staff was amazing and recommended my favorites like the pepper crusted fillet with truffle spinach ğŸ¤© and the desserts were 10/10. 100000 layer chocolate cake and the cheesecake!!

Why are you looking at the reviews and not already at this restaurant ?!? The food is amazing! Must get the steak (excellent seasoning) and must get the desserts!! The staff is amazing and shout out to the manager Sofia for making my birthday experience a memorable one to remember!!

I cannot stress enough how incredible the service was at this restaurant. I came to Strip House for a friendâ€™s Birthday Dinner and from start to finish, The attention to detail was just astounding.

I was first to arrive in our group and the waitress comes over and she asked me if I would like to drink while Iâ€™m waiting so I told her â€˜Sure!â€™. I requested a gin martini with olives, and she informed me that they had a selection of olives to choose from, and that she would highly recommend the truffled blue cheese-stuffed olives.

After I finish my martini, she asked me if I would like another and I told her I would like to switch to red wine for my dinner to pair with my steak. Later, while my steak was being prepared, she approached me and said â€œYour steak is now being prepared. Iâ€™d be more than happy to give you my top three selections of wine as they will pair really well with your dinnerâ€.

It has been a long time since Iâ€™ve sat down at a restaurant and heard my waitress pour as much passion and dedication into her job and service as she did with me.

And it didnâ€™t end there. The bussers the other wait staff were incredibly kind and gracious, and were very attentive to our needs from the moment we walked in until the moment we left the restaurant. You just donâ€™t see this level of service in restaurants much anymore. I cannot wait to go back!

Came here with a group of 10 to celebrate a friendâ€™s birthday â€” and Strip House Midtown made it unforgettable!

Truffle blue cheese olivesâ€¦ excuse me? Thatâ€™s HEAVEN ğŸ«’ğŸ”¥
Appetizers, perfectly cooked steaks, spot-on wine pairings, and dreamy desserts â€” every bite was a hit.

Huge shoutout to Manager Sofia and her amazing team. Their hospitality and deep knowledge of food + wine made us feel so taken care of.

What a night! Thank you Strip House for making our celebration so special. Weâ€™ll 100% be back! ğŸ¥‚ğŸ‰ğŸ·ğŸ¥©
Had the most amazing bday dinner at Strip House and no detail was spared. From the food to the service everything was amazing!

Our server was named Zack. He was excellent. As were the gentlemen who bussed the tables and kept our water full (that is a big deal to me).
When I made the reservations I mentioned it was my sonâ€™s 10th birthday.  The woman at the front greeted us with warm birthday wishes and took us to our table.
Zack followed suit and made my son feel special and took care of everything we needed.
The food was ok.  I ordered the steak medium.  It looked pretty rare.  I donâ€™t like it that way.
The sides were good.  The creamed spinach and potatoes (top of the list) were very good.  Plentiful as well.
My son hadnâ€™t been to too many nice restaurants. He was dazzled by the lighting and decor.  Of course it didnâ€™t occur to me until we were In front of stills of burlesque dancers why the place was called â€œStrip House.â€  Now I know.
Finally, we got the famous 24 layer slice of cake.  The top layer is excellent.  My son and I both liked it.  The other 23 layers werenâ€™t great.  Didnâ€™t even finish it at home.
I want to mention again, they made us feel they knew this was an occasion that mattered.  That really meant a lot to me.  Excellent service.
Food was really the best we had for a long time. A bit noisy

The Strip House on East 12th Street is fantastic. Excellent food, great cocktails, outstanding service and the best bar. The staff and management team are the most warm and friendly group of people. It's a neighborhood gem with a great vibe. Every time I bring a friend, all they want to know is "when can we go back?". It's a terrific spot to celebrate a special occasion as well as to hang out on a random Tuesday (or any night for that matter).
Amazing service, tuna tartare is second to none. Steaks cooked to perfection. Love the old school speakeasy vibe of restaurant. Very hip and sexy

The Strip House (Midtown Location) â€“

A Perfect Blend of Fine Dining and Game Night Vibes

Returning to The Strip House Midtown felt like visiting an old friendâ€”and once again, they delivered an experience that was nothing short of exceptional. This time, I came with two close friends to catch the Knicks playoff game, and the team at Strip House went above and beyond to make sure we had the best of both worlds: elite-level steakhouse fare and front-row seats to the action.

They had three seats reserved for us right in front of the TV in the bar areaâ€”prime real estate for the gameâ€”and it made for the perfect setup. Despite the more casual setting, the attention to detail, service, and food quality never wavered.

We started things off with a round of cocktails: I had my go-to Old Fashioned, one friend opted for a classic Manhattan, and the other went with a crisp Gin & Tonic. Each drink was expertly prepared and set the tone for the meal.

Appetizers:
â€¢ Strip House Roasted Bacon â€“ Just like last time: thick-cut, smoky, and caramelized to perfection. Still an all-time favorite.
â€¢ Salmon Tartare on Crispy Rice â€“ A fantastic new addition. The salmon was fresh and flavorful, and the crispy rice added a satisfying crunch.
â€¢ Gnocchi Cacio e Pepe with Butter-Poached Lobster â€“ Rich, luxurious, and bursting with flavor. The gnocchi had that ideal pillowy texture, and the lobster elevated the dish to another level.

EntrÃ©es:
â€¢ Dry-Aged New York Strip & Dry-Aged Ribeye â€“ Both steaks were absolute showstoppers, perfectly cooked to a juicy medium-rare with that signature Strip House char. Deep, beefy flavor from the dry-aging process made each bite unforgettable.

Sides:
â€¢ 1000-Layer Goose Fat Potatoes â€“ Just as incredible as I remembered: crispy, buttery, and dangerously addictive.
â€¢ Kung Pao Brussels Sprouts â€“ A fun, flavorful twist with a nice kick and crunchy texture. A great contrast to the richness of the steaks.

For the wine, we chose a bottle of Borgogno Nebbiolo "No Name"â€”elegant, earthy, and a beautiful pairing for the bold flavors of our meal. It was a standout.

Even though I didnâ€™t take any photos this time (a rare miss), it was for the best reasonâ€”we were too caught up in great conversation, amazing food, and the thrill of watching the Knicks hold their own in a playoff battle that they unfortunately lost. It felt like the kind of night you just soak in rather than document.

Dessert:
We couldnâ€™t leave without indulging in the Strip Houseâ€™s iconic desserts.

â€¢ Strip House Signature 24-Layer Chocolate Cake â€“ Just as decadent and unforgettable as always. Moist, rich, and layered with pure chocolate bliss.

â€¢ New York Cheesecake â€“ A delightful surprise: light, airy, and paired with a heavenly Oreo cookie crust and fresh berries. It struck the perfect balance between creamy and refreshing, and offered a nice contrast to the richness of the cake.

As always, Chef Larry was in the kitchen and made sure we were well taken care ofâ€”his passion for hospitality is palpable and adds so much heart to the experience. Midway through the meal, Sean, who had served us on our last visit, recognized me and came over to say hello, which was a great surprise. While Angela wasnâ€™t on duty, Sophia, the manager that night, stopped by to introduce herself, welcomed us warmly, and generously sent over a round of Balvenie 14 Caribbean Cask as an after-dinner treatâ€”a perfect, smooth finish to a stellar evening.

The service was once again flawless. It was a true team effort with every staff member checking in, topping off water glasses, and making sure we were happy throughout the night without ever feeling interrupted.

The Strip House continues to deliver a rare combination of luxury dining and genuine hospitality. Whether itâ€™s a special occasion or a game night hangout, they know how to make it memorable. Already looking forward to visit number three.
The steak was amazing & you have to try the 24 layer cake!
Impeccable experience. Thomas was absolutely outstanding in serving us, he made our evening and our holiday. He is so knowledgeable, kind and generous. Thank you Thomas ! From my mum and I
VERY loud. Sat upstairs and was crammed in by crowded bar and large groups. Yelled the whole way through dinner. Food and service was good, but not good enough to go back with the atmospheric volume.
Locale tipicamente americano carne spaziale. Molta gente a bere al bancone e quindi un po' rumoroso. C'Ã¨ stato un tempo di attesa ampiamente ripagato dal gusto

Strip House is amazing my first time here. The ambiance is beautiful. The staff is so welcoming. I will definitely be back. Great drinks, food and location.

We visited the Strip House twice during our three night trip. Night one we were more than impressed, obviously since we returned so soon. Drinks were fantastic. Service was exceptional. Our waiter went above and beyond for us, even recommending things to do in the area. We got our food in a timely manner.

Overall great experience. Sides are a sharing size. The cake is to die for.

The Strip House (Midtown Location)

Our recent visit to The Strip House (Midtown) was nothing short of spectacularâ€”one of the best meals Iâ€™ve had in a long time. It was a guysâ€™ night out with some friends I hadnâ€™t seen in a while, so we decided to splurge on an unforgettable dinner. With Chef Larry in the kitchen, we were in for an incredible experience from start to finish.

We kicked things off with a round of Old Fashioned, expertly crafted with top-notch bourbon, setting the tone for the night. As we moved into appetizers, our waiter Seanâ€”who had an impressive knowledge of winesâ€”helped us select a beautiful Napa Valley Cabernet that paired perfectly with the starters Chef Larry recommended.

Appetizers:
â€¢	Tuna Tartare w/ Black Tobiko Caviar â€“ Fresh, light, and packed with flavor.
â€¢	Strip House Roasted Bacon â€“ Thick, smoky, and perfectly caramelized.
â€¢	Bufala Burrata w/ Toast â€“ Creamy, rich, and a must-try.
â€¢	Brussels Sprouts â€“ Charred to perfection with just the right amount of crunch.

For the main course, we went all in with the Bone-in KC Strip and DA Ribeye, both cooked to a flawless medium-rare. The steaks had a perfect sear on the outside, a juicy pink center, and were seasoned just right. At Chef Larryâ€™s suggestion, we tried the bÃ©arnaise and au poivre saucesâ€”both fantastic additions to the already mouthwatering steaks.

Sides to Share:
â€¢	Lobster Mac & Cheese â€“ Decadent, creamy, and packed with tender lobster.
â€¢	Black Truffle Creamed Spinach â€“ Rich and indulgent, with just the right amount of truffle.
â€¢	1000-Layer Goose Fat Potatoes â€“ Crisp, buttery, and utterly addictive.
â€¢	Charred Broccoli â€“ A perfectly smoky and flavorful balance to the richer dishes.

Sean continued to guide us through the meal, suggesting another exquisite Napa Valley Cabernet to accompany our steaks. His service was exceptionalâ€”always there when we needed him but never intrusive.

What truly made the night special was the personal touch from Chef Larry, who checked on us multiple times, ensuring everything was just right. He even took a moment to sit with us for a photo and some laughs, making the experience feel personal and memorable.

To cap off the evening, we indulged in two show-stopping desserts:
â€¢	Strip House Signature 24-Layer Chocolate Cake â€“ A rich, chocolate loverâ€™s dream.
â€¢	Bananas Foster Baked Alaska â€“ A visually stunning, caramelized delight.

Just when we thought the night couldnâ€™t get better, Angela, the Assistant General Manager, stopped by to introduce herself and generously offered us a complimentary after-dinner drink. She poured us a smooth Balvenie Scotch, the perfect way to end an already extraordinary meal.

This was my first visit to The Strip House, but it certainly wonâ€™t be my last. The service was impeccable, the food was phenomenal, and the hospitality exceeded five stars. I canâ€™t wait to go back!

Travelled from Canada in November, and we are STILL talking about this restaurant. Can't wait to go back. Our server was AMAZING (young man with tattoos). The interior and atmosphere were very burlesque. The food was delicious and timely - the filet mignon was one of the best steaks I have ever had. I also had the best cocktail I have ever had, called Blowin' Smoke. Our only regret is not having tried the chocolate cake. Very memorable experience - highly recommend!

Classic steakhouse vibe with some red details and pictures of "stripping" woman at the wall (to fit their name..).

The steak was decent, but not more than other steaks I've had before. The porterhouse was tender, but not very juicy or super rich in its flavour. The menu said that the meat was for two, but it was rather for three.
The black truffle creamed spinach was a nice side. I also had their famous chocolate cake. It was very big. Moist. But not the rich chocolate flavour I'd hoped. Some nutty tones.

The restaurant was very cute. The decor was one of a can definitely Instagram worthy. My fiancÃ© and I came here for our 3rd year anniversary and they made it so special they gave us an anniversary card and the infamous chocolate 24 layer cake! The  steak was very flavorful and tender. The side were a good portion and delicious. The crab cake was very fresh and very little filling .  The pretzel bread was the best bread ever. I would definitely have to recommend this restaurant friends and I would definitely come back when Iâ€™m in town.

This was my 2nd time dining at Strip House when in NYC. The food is always delicious and well prepared. The service this time was not up to standards. After looking around the room for our server, the manager noticed and  had to come by to take our order. At that time, she magically appeared and took over. Others had brought out the food, and we saw more of them than her. Good thing the food made up for it!

Old school NY steakhouse. Steak was Pittsburg style with perfect temperature.  Truffle creamed spinach was delicious.  Service was attentive and the famous 24 layer chocolate cake. Was very good. Not the best o ever had but for sure worth trying.  Surprising not very rich.  Was a wonderful stop.

Updated Review as of Feb 7th Friday dinner, exactly a week after our Girl's Night Out dinner:

My girl's night the other Friday was so perfect that I had to come back last night for an early Valentines Day dinner and treat my husband. I raved how good everything was last Friday so needless to say, expectations were set pretty high.

First off, we arrived like 25 mins. early last night and they seated us immediately. Also gave us the best booth overlooking a glimpse of the action below. Terrence was great, thank you! Buffy immediately greeted me and recognized me from last week and said Alyssa would be taking care of us. Alyssa was INCREDIBLE! Honestly without her super warm and attentive service, this updated review may have been lower than a 4. Alyssa was definitely above 5 out of 5. Thank you so very much, Alyssa. Truly one of the very best we encountered living here in NYC!

Started off with a glass of Rose Cremant from Alsace while my husband had a 9 oz Argentinian Malbec. Both great. Bread and butter comes and it was yum, thanks for the additional pretzels! We also enjoyed the bacon appetizer, perfect with that honey mustard dip. The French Onion soup arrived but noticeably smaller size and a different bowl/container and not as cheesy and good from last week, that's okay. But the reason wht this isn't a repeat 5-star from last week is because the Wagyu Steak Frites is where it fell flat. My husband's medium preference came out medium rare and my supposedly medium rare felt rare. That and it lacked salt. Like they seemed to have forgotten to put salt. I ordered an au poivre sauce and even with it, it couldnt compensate for it being underseasoned. My husband was trying to get some salt from the pretzels to put in his steak. He specifically asked me to not complain or ask for salt to not offend or be seen as wanting to be comp'd. So I ate 65% and was asked if I wanted it to go and I just said no it's okay. So I'm not sure what happened in the kitchen. I actually felt somehow bad because my husband said, you said it was really good. Oh well. Too bad I couldn't control the consistency in taste and quality of the steak, right. ;)

Desserts came and we were excited for our 12 layer chocolate cakes. But we were pleasantly surprised by the delicious Cheesecake too. We ended up finishing it and taking the chocolate cake slices home. Still tasted divine when we enjoyed it today.

Will emphasize that I'm still a big fan and especially commend the team and the service esp. Alyssa, Buffy, Terrence etc. I just wish the Wagyu steak wasn't a let down last night.

Came here for restaurant week because I saw that they were offering steak AND their famous chocolate cake.

Steak itself was alright but the truffle sauce they had was DELICIOUS. The chocolate cake was also perfectly balanced; not too fudgey and not too dry, not too sweet either. Iâ€™m glad I came here during restaurant week where they offer three course for $60 because I feel everything is too overpriced otherwise.

Service was good. Staff was nice, attentive, and coordinated.

Atmosphere was also quite nice. The place had an early 1900s feel to it and the walls are decorated with photos of old Hollywood stars.

We were served steak without steak knives, and the waitress never noticed.

This was a disappointing experience purely from a service standpoint. Went with a friend for some steak, and a couple things to note about a midtown steakhouse on a weekday 1) there are lots of client dinners occurring in the area and 2) these client dinners are typically middle age men who are going to spend a corporate budget.

After a long wait for giving our orders, it was fairly obvious that we were not a priority table (see reason #2 above). We were ok with that! What really changed the tone of dinner was being served steak without the proper knives, and no matter how long we tried to get our waitressâ€™s attention, she never noticed. It was finally a busboy who noticed about 10-15 minutes in that we hadnâ€™t touched our food.

Even weirder, when the check arrived, there is a text line on the receipt that says â€œa suggested gratuity of 15-20% is customary,â€ andâ€¦ the waitress circled the 20? Why? Just why. We were truly lost for explanation on this one, but that was our experience. Food was decent.

EDIT: Adding an update to include that our sauce was forgotten initially as well. And then we were charged for it twice on the bill.

I and my bf both agree that this is one of the best steakhouses ever. Food and service were so on point. We absolutely loved their appetizer diver scallops. For entree, we ordered a porterhouse for 2. The steak was so juicy inside andâ€¦
Incredible experience. The waitstaff were amazing. The recommendations were ğŸ’¯ Steak and lobster mash were just so good. Ambiance is old school modern chic

Great restaurant! Iâ€™ve been to the one downtown and this one was just as good. Excellent pepper crusted steaks. Tasted amazing. Our waiter was great and made us feel very welcomed. Had a lovely dinner and I will definitely be back. Theâ€¦

Indulge in Steakhouse Excellence at Strip House! ğŸ¸ğŸ¥©

â­â­â­â­â­

Strip House Steakhouse is the epitome of culinary excellence, offering everything you could possibly want in a dining experience. From the moment you step through the doors, you're greeted with a welcoming atmosphere that sets the stage for an unforgettable meal.

The service at Strip House is nothing short of perfect. Attentive and knowledgeable staff ensure that every aspect of your dining experience is flawless, from seating arrangements to recommendations on the menu.

And speaking of the menu, prepare to be amazed by the selection of mouthwatering dishes. Of course, the star of the show is the steak, and Strip House delivers in spades. Each cut is cooked to perfection, with just the right amount of char and flavor.

But what truly sets Strip House apart is their attention to detail. The little extra touch of garlic with each steak adds a burst of flavor that elevates the dish to new heights. It's a small gesture that makes a big difference and has become a favorite among patrons.

And let's not forget about the cocktails! Strip House offers an impressive array of libations, each expertly crafted and bursting with flavor. Whether you're in the mood for a classic martini or something more adventurous, their cocktail menu has something for everyone.

In summary, Strip House Steakhouse is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a truly exceptional dining experience. From the atmosphere to the service to the food and drinks, every aspect is top-notch. Don't miss the opportunity to indulge in steakhouse perfection at Strip House! ğŸ¥©ğŸ¸
